intro: Ardisia hokouensis, commonly known as the Hokou arrowleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Primulaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the mountainous areas of Vietnam and Cambodia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, red berries that mature in the fall. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
